inclusion.criterion: an audiogram performed as standard of care for evaluation and management of chronic tinnitus
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: transdermal lidocaine patches will be administered to the participant's torso, either the upper back or chest, at his or her preference
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patches will be applied first thing in the morning to these areas daily, and kept on for twelve hours
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: all relevant patient information including symptoms checklists, results of TFI, and other important patient care information will be recorded in the UC Davis Electronic Medical Record (EMR) for each encounter under the appropriate encounter subheading
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the patient data will also be transposed into a REDCap database for patient tracking, evaluation, and analysis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: each participant will continue with either the baseline dosage or an increased dosage based upon his or her response and tolerance to the drug
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the participant will be asked to follow-up in 4 weeks by phone
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: each participant will be prescribed thirty transdermal lidocaine patches, so that one patch can be applied daily for 12 hours, as indicated by the manufacturer
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the participant will undergo a twelve hour drug recess off of the transdermal lidocaine following patch removal at night
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: all subjects will be enrolled sequentially and assigned a schedule that works best with his or her ability to follow-up
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Previous exposure to lidocaine as a treatment for tinnitus
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Taking medications, herbal remedies and supplements that may interact with lidocaine, including but not limited to antivirals, benzodiazepines, and St. John's Wart
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 55-year-old man who was recently diagnosed with Parkinson's disease. He has hypertension and hypercholesterolemia in his past medical history.
